snippet: If the measure is not thrown out, House Republicans plan to force a repeal vote, while top officials at the White House are projecting confidence that the justices will rule in their favor.
abstract: House Republicans plan to force a vote to repeal Pres Obama's new health care law should the Supreme Court decide to uphold it; move would reinforce the party's deep opposition to the law, which has become central to their political identity; Obama's Democratic allies are also preparing their response to a potentially unfavorable decision, gearing up to press Republicans on the issue of the uninsured.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: If the measure is not thrown out, House Republicans plan to force a repeal vote, while top officials at the White House are projecting confidence that the justices will rule in their favor.

headline.seo: Parties Strategize for Dealing With Supreme Court Decision on Health Care
headline.main: With Justices Set to Rule on Health Law, 2 Parties Strategize
headline.print_headline: Parties Plan Next Move Once Supreme Court Rules on Health Care

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
